obtained: Maple Syrup is obtained by placing a Tapper on a Maple Tree. It is produced every seven to eight days.
Oak Resin is obtained by placing a Tapper on an Oak Tree. It is produced every six to seven days.
Pine Tar is obtained by placing a Tapper on a Pine Tree. It is produced every four to five days.
The Soda Machine is a piece of equipment received upon completing the Joja Community Development Form. It cannot be purchased or crafted.
A Dinasaur Egg is obtained from an Artifact Spot. It can also be laid by a Dinasaur once every 7 days.
A Duck Egg is obtained from a Duck and is produced every two days.

preference.obtained: A Duck Feather is obtained from  Duck with sufficient friendship depending on luck and mood. It can also be found at the Travelling Cart on occasion.
White and Brown Eggs are produced every morning by Chickens.
Goat Milk is produced by at Goat and can be collected every other day.
Large White and Brown Eggs are produced every morning by Chickens with sufficient friendship
Large Goat Milk is obtained from a Goat with sufficient friendship and mood. It can be collected every other day.
Large Milk is obtained from a Cow with sufficient friendship. It can be collected every day.
Milk is obtained from a Cow by using a Milk Pail. It can be collected every morning.
The Rabbit's Foot is obtained from a Rabbit with sufficient friendship, mood, and luck. It may also be purchased from the Travelling Cart or dropped by Serpents in the Skull Cavern.
Slime is obtained as a drop from killing slimes, from Slime Balls, or can be purchased from Krobus on Mondays.
Slime Balls are produced by Slimes in the Slime Hutch. The Slimes must be given water to produce Slime Balls
Truffles spawned by Pigs in Spring, Summer, and Fall. Pigs must be outside to find Truffles.
Void Eggs are produced by Void Chickens every morning. They may also be purchased from the Travelling Cart or from Krobus.
Wool is obtained from Sheep or Rabbits. Sheep can be sheared for Wool once every three days. Rabbits have a chance of producing wool every morning.
The Amphibian Fossil can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest or The Mountains, and from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Anchor can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Beach or from Fishing Treasure Chests.

The Ancient Doll can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest, the Bus Stop area, or Pelican Town, and from Fishing Treasure Chests.  It can also be received as a gift from Jas or Vincent at the Feast of the Winter Star.
The Ancient Drum can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest, Pelican Town, or the Bus Stop area. It can also be found by digging up sand in the Mines.
The Ancient Seed can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest or the Mountains, and from Fishing Treasure Chests
The Ancient Sword can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest or the Mountains, and from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Arrowhead can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, Cindersap Forest, or Bus Stop area.
The Bone Flute can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, Cindersap Forest, or Pelican Town, digging up sand in the Mines, or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Chewing Stick can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, Cindersap Forest, or Pelican Town, and from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Chicken Statue can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Chipped Amphora can be found digging in Pelican Town.
The Dried Starfish can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Beach or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Dwarf Gadget can be found by digging up sand tiles in the Mines.  It can also be found in a Magma Geode or Omni Geode.
The Dwarf Scroll One can be found in The Mines from floors 1 to 120 and as a drop in the Secret Woods from a Green Slime.
The Dwarf Scroll Two can be found in The Mines from floors 40 to 65 and as a drop from the Blue Slime in the Secret Woods.
The Dwarf Scroll Three can be found in The Mines deeper than floor 40, as a drop from a Lava Bat, and in the Skull Cavern. It is also dropped by slimes in the Secret Woods.
The Dwarf Scroll Four can be found as a drop from any monster, or using the Hoe on dirt in The Mines deeper than level 81.
The Dwarvish Helm can be found by digging up sand tiles in The Mines or found inside Geodes or Omni Geodes.
Elvish Jewelry can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
Glass Shards can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Beach or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Golden Mask can be found by digging up Artifact Spots in the Desert.
The Golden Relic can be found by digging in the Desert.
The Nautilus Fossil can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Beach or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Ornamental Fan can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Beach, Cindersap Forest, or Pelican Town.  It can also be found in Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Palm Fossil can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest, the Beach, or the Desert.
The Prehistoric Handaxe can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, Cindersap Forest, or the Bus Stop area.
The Prehistoric Rib can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Pelican Town.
The Prehistoric Scapula can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Pelican Town or Cindersap Forest.
The Prehistoric Skull can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains.
The Prehistoric Tibia can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest or at the Railroad.
The Prehistoric Tool can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, Cindersap Forest, or the Bus Stop area.  It can also be found in Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Prehistoric Vertebra can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot at the Bus Stop.
The Rare Disc can be found by digging sand tiles in the Mines, as a drop from monsters, or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Rusty Cog can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Mountains, digging up sand tiles in the Mines (around floor 14), or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Rusty Spoon can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot or from Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Rusty Spur can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot or in Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Skeletal Hand can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in the Backwoods.
The Skeletal Tail can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot or in Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Strange Doll can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot or in Fishing Treasure Chests.
The Trilobite can be found by digging up an Artifact Spot in Cindersap Forest, the Beach, or the Mountains.
Beer is made from putting Wheat in a Keg, taking 1 to 2 days. It is also available at The Saloon for 400g.
Cheese is made from the Cheese Press using Milk, taking 3.3 hours.
Cloth is made from the Loom using Wool, taking 4 hours.It can also be made from recycling a Soggy Newspaper using the Recycling Machine, and is an occasional drop from Mummies.
Coffee is made by placing five Coffee Beans inside a Keg. It is also available at The Saloon for 300g.
Duck Mayonnaise is  made with the Mayonnaise Machine using a Duck Egg.
Goat Cheese is made by placing Goat Milk in a Cheese Press, taking 3.3 hours.
Honey is made from the Bee House, using a variety of flowers. Honey is produced every 4 days in every season other than Winter.  It can also be purchased from the Oasis on Fridays for 200g.
Juice is made by putting any vegetable into a Keg, taking approximately 4 days.
Mayonnaise is made from putting an egg in the Mayonnaise Machine, taking 3 hours.
Mead is made from placing Honey inside a Keg, taking 10 hours.
Oil is made from the Oil Maker using Corn, Sunflower, or Sunflower Seeds. It can also be obtained from Pierre's General Store for 200g.
Pale Ale is by putting Hops into a Keg, taking 1-2 days.
Truffle Oil is made in the Oil Maker from a Truffle. It takes 5 to 6 hours to produce.
Void Mayonnaise is made by placing a Void Egg inside the Mayonnaise Machine, or it may be fished from the Witch's Swamp.
Wine is made by placing fruit into a Keg, taking 7 days. It is also sometimes available for purchase from the Travelling Cart.
Jelly is made by placing fruit into a Preserves Jar. It takes about 3 days to produce.
Pickles are made by placing vegetable into a Preserves Jar. It takes about 3 days to produce.
Acient Seeds are crafted from an Ancient Seed Artifact. They can also be made by placing an Ancient Fruit into a Seed Maker. They are occassionally available for purchase from the Travelling Cart.
The Barbed Hook Tackle can be crafted from 1 Copper Bar, 1 Iron Bar, and 1 Gold Bar. It can also be purchased from Will's Fish Shop for 1000 gold.
A Bee House is made by crafting using 40 Wood, 8 Coal, 1 Iron Bar, and 1 Maple Syrup.
A Bomb can be crafted from 4 Iron Ore and 1 Coal, or can be purchased from the Dwarf for 600 gold.
A Cask can be crafted using 20 Wood and 1 Hardwood. The crafting recipe becomes available after the final Farmhouse upgrade.
A Charcoal Kiln can be crafted using 20 Wood and 1 Gold Bar. It can also be obtained by completing the Construction Bundle in the Crafts Room.
A Cheese Press is crafted using 45 Wood, 45 Stone, 10 Hardwood, and 1 Copper Bar. It can also be obtained by completing the Animal Bundle in the Pantry.
A Cherry Bomb can be crafted using 4 Copper Ore and 1 Coal. It can also be purchased from the Dwarf for 300 gold.
A chest is crafted using 50 Wood.
The Cork Bobber Tackle can be crafted using 10 Wood, 5 Hardwood, and 10 Slime. It can also be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 750 gold.
Crab Pots can be crafted using 40 Wood and 3 Iron Bar. They can also be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 1500 gold.
Crystalariums are crafted using 99 Stone, 5 Gold Bars, 2 Iridium Bars, and 1 Battery Pack. A Crystalarium is also the reward for completing the 25000 bundle in the Vault.
The Dressed Spinner Tackle is crafted using 2 Iron Bars and 1 Cloth. It can also be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 1000 gold.
The Drum Block is crafted using 10 Stone, 1 Copper Ore, and 20 Fiber.
Explosive Ammo can be crafted using 1 Iron Bar adn 2 Coal. It is also sold by the Adventurer's Guild for 100 gold a piece if you have the Slingshot or Master Slingshot with you.

Fall seeds are crafted using 1 Blackberry, 1 Common Mushroom, 1 Hazelnut, and 1 Wild Plum. Each batch yields 10 seeds. Fall seeds can also be obtained by placing a Common Mushroom in a Seed Maker. They are also occasionally available for purchase at the Travelling Cart.
The Field Snack can be crafted using 1 Acorn, 1 Maple Seed, and 1 Pine Cone. It can also be found in Garbage Cans in Pelican Town.
The Flute Block is crafted using 10 Wood, 1 Copper Ore, and 20 Fiber.
Furnaces are crafted using 25 Stone and 20 Copper Ore. A Furnace is also the reward for completing the Blacksmith's Bundle in the Boiler Room.

A Gold Bar is created by smelting 5 Gold Ore in a furnace with 1 coal for fuel, or by transmuting 2 Iron Bars into one Gold Bar. Smelting Gold Ore in a furnace takes 5 in-game hours.  The Transmute (Au) recipe is earned at Mining Level 7. A Gold Bar can be found (rarely) in the Garbage Can next to the Blacksmith.  Five Gold Bars are the reward for completing the  Enchanter's Bundle on the Bulletin Board.  If Clint is your secret gift-giver at the Feast of the Winter Star, he may give you 5 Gold Bars.Gold bars are used in a variety of crafting recipes and are used to upgrade tools to tier 4. One Gold Bar can be sold for 250g.
The Iridium Band combines the effects of the Glow Ring, Magnet Ring, and Ruby Ring.  Its effects stack with another Iridium Band, a glow ring, a magnet ring, or a ruby ring.
See also: Equipment

An Iron Bar is created by smelting 5 Iron Ore in a furnace with 1 coal for fuel, or by Crafting the Transmute (Fe) recipe (3 Copper Bars into one Iron Bar).  Iron Bars may also occasionally be found in Garbage Cans after receiving the Furnace blueprints from Clint.Smelting iron ore in a furnace takes 2 in-game hours.  The Transmute (Fe) recipe is earned at Mining Level 4.Iron bars are used in a variety of crafting recipes and are used to upgrade tools to tier 3. Each iron bar can be sold for 120g.
The Keg is a type of Artisan Equipment used to make Artisan Goods in Stardew Valley.  A Keg is the reward for completing the  Artisan Bundle in the Pantry.
Life Elixir is an edible crafted item.  The recipe is earned at Combat skill level 2.

The Lightning Rod creates a  Battery Pack 24 hours after getting hit by lightning during a storm. It is not necessary for the player to be on the farm when the lightning strike happens.Since rods do not protect a specific area, the exact placement of a rod on the farm has no bearing on its chance to intercept a lightning strike. A Lightning Rod has a very good chance of intercepting a lightning bolt if it isn't already processing one. If it doesn't succeed, though, the lightning is more likely to strike trees than crops.A lightning rod is the reward for completing the  10,000 Bundle in the Vault.
The Loom is equipment used to make Artisan Goods. It takes wool and turns it into cloth.

The Mayonnaise Machine is equipment used to make Artisan Goods.  It takes eggs and turns them into Mayonnaise (regular, Void Mayonnaise, Duck Mayonnaise). Large Eggs, and Dinosaur Eggs yield gold-quality mayonnaise.

The Mega Bomb is an explosive one-time use item. It damages certain items within its explosion radius (including the player). Other items are impervious to its effects.  The Bouncer guarding the Casino drops a Mega Bomb to ward off the player if they try to enter the Casino without permission.Mega Bombs can be crafted or purchased from the Dwarf for 1,000g.  Kent may randomly send you a Mega Bomb in the mail after reaching four hearts.Tip: Due to the wide blast area it is often a challenge to use the Mega Bomb without taking damage. Ensure you have ample healing supplies.
The Oil Maker is equipment used to make Artisan Goods. It takes items and turns them into oil.
Oil of Garlic is an edible crafted item. The recipe is earned at Combat skill level 6.  Consuming Oil of Garlic gives the Oil of Garlic Buff which lasts for 10 minutes.

The Preserves Jar is a type of Artisan Equipment used to make Artisan Goods. It takes a single fruit or vegetable and converts it into Jelly or Pickles, respectively.Preserves Jars consume less time than Kegs, but will usually yield less profit. However, low-value, high-yield crops like Blackberries, Green Beans and Corn are actually more profitable in the preserves jar than in the keg, as well as being much faster to process. As an example, corn juice, which is made in the keg, is worth 113g, but corn pickles, which are made in the preserves jar, are worth 150g. Salmonberry wine, which is made in the keg, is only worth 15g, but Salmonberry jelly, which is made in the preserves jar, is worth 60g.Jellies and Pickles are common villager favorites (see Friendship).A Preserves Jar is the reward for completing the  Quality Crops Bundle in the Pantry.
See also: Equipment

A Recycling Machine is crafted with 25 Wood, 25 Stone and 1 Iron Bar. It is used to turn Trash collected from Fishing into useful items. It can only be crafted after achieving a  fishing level of 4. It is the reward for completing the  Field Research Bundle on the Bulletin Board.All items take 1 hour to process.The Recycling Machine cannot recycle Joja Cola or Rotten Plant.

The Ring of Yoba has a chance of giving the  Yoba's Blessing buff after the player takes damage.  The lower the player's health and the higher the daily luck, the higher the chance of receiving the buff.  The Yoba's Blessing buff grants immunity, but only for 5 seconds.

A Scarecrow is a craftable item that prevents crows from eating crops.  Scarecrows can be crafted at Farming level 1.  Scarecrows are not needed to protect crops grown from Wild Seeds, since crows do not attack them.

The Seed Maker is a piece of Refining Equipment that produces seeds from a harvested crop or one of four foraged items: Wild Horseradish, Spice Berry, Common Mushroom, or Winter Root. It takes 20 in-game minutes to process seeds.A Seed Maker is the reward for completing the  Dye Bundle on the Bulletin Board.

The Slime Egg-Press is Equipment used to create Slime Eggs, unlocked after reaching Combat Level 6. It is a very helpful item for raising your own slimes in the Slime Hutch.It can be placed anywhere,  and picked up by hitting it with a tool. The Egg-Press can be started by adding 100 slime (you'll need to select the slime via toolbar and then click on the Egg-Press).The production progress takes one in-game day.You can gain eggs of every existing color (green, blue, red and purple). Green eggs are by far the most common ones, and purple the rarest.The color and gender of the egg are completely random and based on luck. It is not necessary to own slimes of a certain color in order to get that color egg via the Egg-Press (e.g., you can receive purple eggs from green slimes).The chances for the press to generate a particular egg are 60% for green eggs, 25% for blue eggs, 10% for red eggs and 5% for purple eggs.

The Slime Incubator is a machine that hatches Slime Eggs into actual Slimes. One incubator comes with the Slime Hutch and will produce slimes that live indoors. You can raise slimes outdoors by crafting a slime incubator yourself.  Eggs take 4000 minutes (approximately 66.66 hours, or 2-3 days) to incubate.
The Spinner is a Tackle, that helps fishing by reducing maximum delay before a nibble by 3.75 seconds. At Fishing Level 6, it can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 500g or crafted.

Spring Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Sp), but when crafted, the result is Spring Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Wild Horseradish, Daffodil, Leek, or Dandelion.  Spring Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Summer Seeds, Fall Seeds, and Winter Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Spring Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Spring Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Spring Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources
See also: Equipment

The Staircase is a consumable mining supply item used to instantly create a ladder that leads down one level in The Mines or Skull Cavern. It cannot be placed on level 0 or 120 of the mines. Staircases cannot be stacked in inventory or chests.Staircases work just like the game-supplied down-ladders. Each one works only for one use. If you leave the mine or return to a higher level and look for one you placed earlier, you will find that it is gone. In addition, once a staircase has been placed, it cannot be picked up again, even if it has not been used.If you do not have enough Stone to craft a staircase, you can buy Stones from Robin at the Carpenter's Shop.  99 Stones at 20g each = 1,980g per staircase.

Summer Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Su), but when crafted, the result is Summer Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Spice Berry, Grape, or Sweet Pea.  Summer Seeds are the only wild seeds that can produce a non-forage crop, the Grape. Summer Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Spring Seeds, Fall Seeds, and Winter Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Summer Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Summer Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Summer Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources

The Tapper is a crafted item that can be placed on a tree to produce Maple Syrup, Oak Resin, or Pine Tar. It can also be placed on a Mushroom Tree to produce different mushrooms. The Tapper can be removed from a tree by hitting it once with an axe. This leaves the Tapper intact and able to be reused.If the Tapper is on a tree when it is struck by lightning, the Tapper will be destroyed and its ingredients will not be recoverable.Tappers placed on Maple Trees, Oak Trees, or Pine Trees will continue to produce during Winter.  Since Mushroom Trees turn to stumps in Winter, tappers placed on them will produce nothing.
The Trap Bobber is a Tackle, that helps fishing by causing the catching bar to decrease 66% slower.  It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 500g, or crafted.

The Treasure Hunter is a Tackle, that helps fishing by preventing fish escape while collecting Treasure Chests, and by increasing the chance to find Treasure Chests by 33% (20% instead of the base 15%).  It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 750g, or crafted.
The Tub o' Flowers is a crafted decorative item that blooms in the Spring and Summer.  Both the Tub o' Flowers and its recipe can be purchased from Pierre at the Flower Dance.
Warrior Energy is a buff that increases Attack by 10 for 5 seconds.

The Wicked Statue is a crafted decorative item in Stardew Valley. Its recipe can be obtained from Krobus for 1,000g.Placing a Wicked Statue in a slime hutch prevents the witch from visiting it and turning all Slimes to black.

Winter Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Wi), but when crafted, the result is Winter Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Crocus, Crystal Fruit, Snow Yam, or Winter Root.  Winter Seeds are the only seed that can grow outdoors during Winter.Winter Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Spring Seeds, Summer Seeds, and Fall Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Winter Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Winter Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Winter Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources
The Worm Bin is a craftable item that can be used to create bait for fishing. The crafting recipe is unlocked at Fishing Level 8. Creates 2-5 pieces of bait once per day.

Bait can be bought at the Fish Shop for 5g each, crafted, or found in Fishing Treasure Chests.  Thirty bait are the reward for completing the  River Fish Bundle in the Fish Tank.Bait cannot be used with the Bamboo Pole. Only the Fiberglass Rod (unlocked at Fishing skill level 2) or the Iridium Rod (unlocked at Fishing skill level 6) can use bait.

The Magnet is a type of bait that doubles the chance of finding Treasure Chests (30% chance instead of 15% base).  It can be crafted,  purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 1,000g after reaching Fishing Skill Level 9, or received as one of the prizes for winning the ice fishing contest at the Festival of Ice.  It can also be received as a gift from Willy at the Feast of the Winter Star.Unlike other bait, magnets cannot be used in Crab Pots.

Wild Bait can be crafted from a recipe obtained from Linus upon reaching four hearts and approaching his Tent around 8:00PM. It cannot be used with the Bamboo Pole. Only the Fiberglass Rod (unlocked at Fishing skill level 2) or the Iridium Rod can use bait.
The Barrel Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Campfire is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Carved Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Gold Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Iron Lamp-post is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.

The Jack-O-Lantern is a craftable decorative lighting item that can be purchased from Pierre's booth at the Spirit's Eve festival for 750g.  You can also buy the recipe from the booth for 2,000g. On the 1st of Winter, it turns into a Rotten Plant (unless stored in a chest or inventory).
The Marble Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Skull Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Stone Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Stump Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.

The Torch is a craftable lighting item that can be held to provide light at night, or in dark areas of The Mines, where they can also be gathered by using a Hoe, a Pickaxe, or an Axe. Torches can also be placed indoors or outdoors to provide lighting.When placing Soggy Newspaper into the Recycling Machine, it can sometimes produce 3 torches.A torch may be placed on top of a Fence.
The Wood Lamp-post is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.
The Wooden Brazier is a crafted lighting item.  It provides light at night.

The Cobblestone Path is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning or weeds.The recipe is already in the player's inventory when the game starts.
The Crystal Floor is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning.The Crystal Floor recipe is sold by Krobus for 500g.

The Crystal Path is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning or weeds.The Crystal Path recipe is sold at the Carpenter's Shop for 1,000g.

The Gravel Path is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning or weeds.The recipe is already in the player's inventory when the game starts.

The Stepping Stone Path is a crafted decor item]. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning or weeds.The Stepping Stone Path recipe is sold at the Carpenter's Shop for 500g.
The Stone Floor is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning.The Stone Floor recipe is sold at the Carpenter's Shop for 500g.
The Straw Floor is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning.The Straw Floor recipe is sold at the Carpenter's Shop for 1,000g.
The Weathered Floor is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning.The Weathered Floor recipe is sold by the Dwarf for 500g.
The Wood Floor is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning.The Wood Floor recipe is sold at the Carpenter's Shop for 500g.

The Wood Path is a crafted decor item. It is is used to create decorative paths on the farm.  It can be destroyed by lightning or weeds.The recipe is already in the player's inventory when the game starts.
The Gate is a craftable item that allows players to pass through fences. It lasts for 100 days. To use: place one gate piece between two fence pieces.
The Hardwood Fence is a craftable item that allows players to block off certain areas of The Farm. It lasts for 558 to 562 days.  It can also be purchased from the Casino for 100 (=1,000g).
The Iron Fence is a craftable item that allows players to block off certain areas of The Farm. It lasts for 240 to 264 days.
The Stone Fence is a craftable item that allows players to block off certain areas of The Farm. It lasts for 110 to 132 days.
The Wood Fence is a craftable item that allows players to block off certain areas of The Farm. It lasts for 46 to 66 days.

Basic Fertilizer is a Fertilizer that helps by improving soil quality. It can be crafted or purchased from Pierre's General Store for 100g.Crops harvested from fertilized tiles have a chance to become quality crops according to the following ratio: \u224833% Regular / \u224833% Silver / \u224833% Gold (assuming level 10 Farming skill).Basic Fertilizer must be placed on tilled soil before planting a seed.Basic Fertilizer affects only the basic harvest, which means that extra crops gained at a single harvest (Potatoes, Blueberries, Cranberries, etc.) will be regular quality.

Basic Retaining Soil is a Fertilizer that helps by keeping soil watered. It can be crafted or purchased from Pierre's General Store for 100g.Basic Retaining Soil can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.

Deluxe Speed-Gro is a Fertilizer that helps by speeding crop growth. It can be crafted or purchased from Pierre's General Store for 150g from year 2 onward, or purchased from the Oasis for 80g on Thursdays.  Ten Deluxe Speed-Gro may also be received as a gift at the Feast of the Winter Star.Deluxe Speed-Gro can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.

Quality Fertilizer is a Fertilizer that improves the chance to grow a quality crop. It can be crafted or purchased from Pierre's General Store after year 2 for 150g.  Thirty Quality Fertilizer are the reward for completing the  5,000 Bundle in the Vault.Crops harvested from fertilized tiles have following quality ratio: \u224810% Regular / \u224830% Silver / \u224860% Gold (assuming level 10 Farming skill).Quality Fertilizer must be placed on tilled soil before planting a seed.Quality Fertilizer only affects the basic harvest, which means that extra crops gained at harvest (Potatoes, Blueberries, Cranberries, etc.) will be of regular quality.

Quality Retaining Soil is a Fertilizer that helps by keeping soil watered. It can be purchased from Pierre's General Store for 150g, from the Oasis for 200g on Saturdays, or crafted.Quality Retaining Soil can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.

Speed-Gro is a Fertilizer that helps by speeding crop growth. It can be crafted or purchased from Pierre's for 100g.  Twenty Speed-Gro is the reward for completing the  Spring Crops Bundle in the Pantry.Speed-Gro can be placed on tilled soil before or after planting a seed, or at any stage of crop growth.

Just as with other farm buildings available from the Carpenter's Shop, the obelisks are placeable and permanent objects on farm land, and are not consumed on use. Likewise, you may visit the Wizard's Tower at any time to move an obelisk's location on the farm, just as you can do with other farm buildings at the Carpenter's Shop.

The Rain Totem is a crafted item that increases the chance of rain for the next day. The recipe becomes available at Foraging Level 9.The Rain Totem may be placed as a decorative item (by left-clicking the mouse).  To activate a Rain Totem, select it in inventory and use it (right-click with the mouse, directly on top of your character).

The Return Scepter is a non-consumable Warp Totem. It warps the player directly outside of your Farmhouse.It's purchasable from Krobus in The Sewers for 2,000,000g, making it the most expensive equipment, and second most expensive item in the game, only behind the Gold Clock. It functions similarly to Warp Totem: Farm, but is not consumed on use and teleports the player to the Farmhouse door instead of the totem warp point.

Warp Totem: Beach is a Warp Totem that teleports the player to The Beach by selecting it in inventory and right-clicking. It can be crafted when the recipe becomes available at Foraging Level 6.  Twenty-five of them can also be received as a gift from Willy at the Feast of the Winter Star.  The Warp Totem: Beach can be sold for 20g. It can be used to bypass events occurring in town without triggering them, but if used while an event is happening at the beach, it will start the event.Five Warp Totem: Beach are the reward for completing the  Ocean Fish Bundle in the Fish Tank.
The Warp Totem: Farm is a Warp Totem that teleports the player to the farm. The recipe becomes available at Foraging Level 8.  A Warp Totem: Farm can be purchased at the Casino for 500.
The Warp Totem: Mountains is a Warp Totem that transports the player to The Mountain. The recipe becomes available at Foraging Level 7.

Just as with other farm buildings available from the Carpenter's Shop, the obelisks are placeable and permanent objects on farm land, and are not consumed on use. Likewise, you may visit the Wizard's Tower at any time to move an obelisk's location on the farm, just as you can do with other farm buildings at the Carpenter's Shop.
Amaranth is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Amaranth Seeds after 7 days.
The Ancient Fruit is a crop in Stardew Valley that grows from Ancient Seeds after 28 days. Thereafter, the mature plant yields another Ancient Fruit every 7 days.
Artichokes are a crop that grows from Artichoke Seeds after 8 days.

The Beet is a vegetable crop that grows from Beet Seeds after 6 days.  Beet Seeds can be purchased from the Oasis.Players have the ability to craft Sugar from Beets by using a Mill. Once placed in the mill, one Beet will make three sugar. Sugar will appear in the box on the right side of the mill the following morning.
Bok Choy is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Bok Choy Seeds after 4 days.
Corn is a crop that grows from Corn Seeds after 14 days.
Cranberries are a crop that grows from Cranberry Seeds after 7 days, and keeps producing fruit every 5 days after maturity.
Eggplant is a crop that grows from Eggplant Seeds after 5 days.

The Fairy Rose is a flower crop that grows from Fairy Seeds after 12 days. Although the profit margins on the Fairy Rose are not exceptional, the Honey made from the flowers represents the most profitable honey.

The Grape is a crop in Stardew Valley. They are grown from Grape Starter in the Fall, which takes 10 days to grow. They can also be foraged in Pelican Town, in the Summer, or grown from Summer Seeds.The sales price of grapes that are grown as a crop (in Fall) receive the Tiller profession bonus (as do all crops). However, the sales price of grapes foraged (in Summer), do not receive the bonus. (Note: there seems to be a program bug in the price that arises when you sell a mixture of crop and forage grapes at the same time.)

Grass is a naturally occurring resource that is present in the Spring, Summer, and Fall seasons. At the start of the game, the player's farm has many unconfined fields of grass. Each day, new grass tufts will grow around existing grass. Grass can be cut using the scythe. Once the player constructs a silo on their farm, each grass cut has a 50% chance of providing hay, which is automatically stored into the player's silo(s).Although grass can occur naturally, the player can choose to start a new patch using Grass Starter. This will place a single tuft of grass, which will spread into additional tufts over time.Occasionally, grass will spawn randomly on unoccupied tiles on the player's farm overnight. These tufts will behave in the same way that player-planted tufts will behave.In the winter, grass will no longer grow. It is recommended that a player stores enough hay to feed their animals for the entire 28-day season in their silos. If you do not have enough hay to feed your animals, you can purchase hay from Marnie at her ranch for 50g

The Pumpkin is a crop that grows from Pumpkin Seeds after 13 days.  It is one of three crops which might produce a giant crop, along with Cauliflower and Melon. After Starfruit it has the second-highest per unit base price of all the normal crops.

The Sunflower is a flower crop that grows from Sunflower Seeds after 8 days. Unlike other flowers, they don't affect the type of Honey produced by nearby Bee Houses.  Harvesting a sunflower will drop 1 Sunflower, and 0-3 Sunflower Seeds.

The Sweet Gem Berry is a crop that grows from a Rare Seed after 24 days. It can be given to Old Master Cannoli in the Secret Woods in order to get a Stardrop. It is not considered a Fruit or Vegetable and so cannot be used in a Keg or Preserves Jar.  It also does not benefit from the Tiller profession. It can be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 9,000-15,000g.Rare Seeds can be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 1,000g in Spring & Summer, or for 600-1,000g in any season.  Rare Seeds can also be produced from a Sweet Gem Berry using the Seed Maker. Despite its high value, the berry is regarded as a neutral gift by everyone in Stardew Valley.
The Yam is a crop in Stardew Valley that grows from Yam Seeds after 10 days. It also has a 3% chance of dropping from Duggies.

The Apple is a fruit grown by planting an Apple Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into an Apple Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Fall.An Apple may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 300-1,000g or found in The Farm Cave, if the fruit bat option is chosen.

The Pomegranate is a fruit grown by planting a Pomegranate Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into a Pomegranate Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Fall.A Pomegranate may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 420-1,000g or found in The Farm Cave, if the fruit bat option is chosen..

The Apricot is a fruit grown by planting an Apricot Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into an Apricot Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Spring.An Apricot may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 150-1,000g or found in The Farm Cave, if the fruit bat option is chosen.

The Cherry is a fruit grown by planting a Cherry Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into a Cherry Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Spring.A Cherry may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 240-1,000g or found in The Farm Cave, if the fruit bat option is chosen.

The Orange is a fruit grown by planting an Orange Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into an Orange Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Summer.An Orange may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 300-1,000g or found in The Cave on the farm, if the fruit bat option is chosen.

The Peach is a fruit grown by planting a Peach Sapling, waiting 28 days for it to grow into a Peach Tree, and harvesting the tree during the Summer.A Peach may be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 420-1,000g or found in The Farm Cave, if the fruit bat option is chosen.

The Acorn is a seed that grows into an Oak Tree.  It can be obtained by shaking/chopping down an Oak Tree at Foraging level 1, in Garbage Cans, or by using an Axe or Pickaxe to dig up an Acorn dropped by a fully grown Oak Tree on The Farm.  An acorn has approximately a 20% chance to grow to the next stage each night during Spring, Summer, or Fall.

The Maple Seed is a seed that grows into a Maple Tree.  It can be obtained by shaking/chopping down a Maple Tree at Foraging level 1, in Garbage Cans, or by using an Axe or Pickaxe to dig up a Maple Seed dropped by a fully grown Maple Tree on The Farm.  A maple seed has approximately a 20% chance to grow to the next stage each night during Spring, Summer, or Fall.

Mixed Seeds are a random type of seed capable of being planted to produce low-grade crops (as listed below). Which crops will grow from them is decided when they are planted. Mixed seeds collected in any season always grow to become crops of the season in which they are planted. They cannot be planted in the Winter, except in the Greenhouse. When planted in the Greenhouse, they become a random low-grade crop from any season.Mixed Seeds can be obtained by cutting Weeds with a Scythe, digging up dirt or sand with a hoe, or from Fishing Treasure Chests. They are also sold by Krobus on Thursdays for 30g.Whenever the Seed Maker is used with any crop, there is a small chance you will get 1-4 Mixed Seeds instead of the crop's seeds.

The Pine Cone is a seed that grows into a Pine Tree.  It can be obtained by shaking/chopping down a Pine Tree at Foraging level 1, in Garbage Cans, or by using an Axe or Pickaxe to dig up a Pine Cone dropped by a fully grown Pine Tree on The Farm.  A pine cone has approximately a 20% chance to grow to the next stage each night during Spring, Summer, or Fall.

Amaranth Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Amaranth.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 70g, at JojaMart for 87g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 35g.
Note: This article is about the fruit seed. For the artifact see the Ancient Seed page.

Artichoke Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Artichokes.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store from second year onward and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 15g.

Beet Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Beets.They can be purchased at the Oasis and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 10g.

Bok Choy Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Bok Choy.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 50g, at JojaMart for 62g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 25g.

Cranberry Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Cranberries.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 240g, at JojaMart for 300g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 60g.When harvested, each Cranberry plant gives 2 Cranberries every 5 days, with a small random chance for more Cranberries.

Eggplant Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Eggplants.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 20g, at JojaMart for 25g and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 10g.When harvested, each Eggplant bush gives 1 Eggplant every 5 days, with a very small random chance for more Eggplants.

Fairy Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Fairy Rose flowers.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 200g, at JojaMart for 250g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 100g.

Fall Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Fa), but when crafted, the result is Fall Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Blackberry, Common Mushroom, Hazelnut, or Wild Plum.Fall Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Spring Seeds, Summer Seeds, and Winter Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Fall Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Fall Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Fall Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources

The Grape Starter is a type of seed. Mature plants yield Grapes.It can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 60g, at JojaMart for 75g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. It can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 30g.

Grass Starter is a type of seed that will instantly place a patch of Grass when used.  Over time, a patch of grass will grow and spread to surrounding tiles on the farm.  Grass can be harvested with the Scythe to produce Hay, once a Silo is built.  In Winter, all grass on the farm will die.Grass Starter is meant to be used outside where farm animals can eat it, but it can be placed inside a Farm Building.  Animals will not eat it, and it will not grow, but it can be harvested to create Hay.

Pumpkin Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Pumpkins.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 100g, at JojaMart for 125g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 50g.

The Rare Seed is a type of seed. A mature plant yields a Sweet Gem Berry.One to five Rare Seeds can be purchased at the Travelling Cart for 1,000g each during Spring and Summer.  During any season, there is also a 1.26% chance that the merchant will be selling 1-5 Rare Seeds for 600-1,000g each. (You may see Rare Seeds occupying two slots in the merchant's offerings in Spring and Summer).  Rare Seeds can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. Despite the description stating that this seed takes all season to grow, it takes only 24 days.  If using Speed-Gro or Deluxe Speed-Gro, the player has up to Day 7 of Fall to plant this seed, and it will be harvestable before Winter.

Sunflower Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Sunflowers and 1-3 Sunflower Seeds.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store for 200g, at JojaMart for 125g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 20g.

Wheat Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Wheat.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store for 10g, at JojaMart for 12g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 5g.

Yam Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Yams.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 50g, at JojaMart for 75g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker.
Note: This article is about the fruit seed. For the artifact see the Ancient Seed page.

Bean starter is a type of seed. Mature plants yield Green Beans.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be made from the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 30g.

Cauliflower Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Cauliflower.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. Nine seeds can be obtained from Gunther at the Museum after donating 5 unique Minerals. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 40g.

A Coffee Bean is both a crop and a plantable seed. Coffee Beans grow and mature 10 days after being planted (and every 2 days thereafter) in either Spring or Summer. Placing 5 Coffee Beans inside a Keg will produce Coffee.They have a rare chance to drop from Dust Sprites (about 1%). They can also be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 2,500g (25% chance) or 100-1,000g (1.26% chance).When harvested, each plant gives four beans every two days, with a small random chance for more beans.

Garlic Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Garlic.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store after year 1 and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 20g.

Grass Starter is a type of seed that will instantly place a patch of Grass when used.  Over time, a patch of grass will grow and spread to surrounding tiles on the farm.  Grass can be harvested with the Scythe to produce Hay, once a Silo is built.  In Winter, all grass on the farm will die.Grass Starter is meant to be used outside where farm animals can eat it, but it can be placed inside a Farm Building.  Animals will not eat it, and it will not grow, but it can be harvested to create Hay.

Jazz Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Blue Jazz flowers.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 15g.

Kale Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Kale.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker.  When shipped, they sell for 35g.

Parsnip Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yeild Parsnips.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart.  Fifteen seeds are provided by Mayor Lewis at the start of the game. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 10g.

Potato Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Potatoes.Potato Seeds can be purchased at Pierre's General Store, JojaMart, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 25g.Potato seeds have a random chance to produce extra potatoes, partially based on Daily Luck.1

Rhubarb Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Rhubarb.They can be purchased at the Oasis and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 50g.

Spring Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Sp), but when crafted, the result is Spring Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Wild Horseradish, Daffodil, Leek, or Dandelion.  Spring Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Summer Seeds, Fall Seeds, and Winter Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Spring Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Spring Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Spring Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources

Strawberry Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Strawberries.They can be purchased for 100g at the Egg Festival. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker.When harvested, each Strawberry plant gives 1 Strawberry every 4 days, with a small random chance for more Strawberries.1
The Tulip Bulb is a type of seed. Mature plants yield Tulips.They can be purchased for 20g at Pierre's General Store or for 25g at JojaMart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker.
Note: This article is about the fruit seed. For the artifact see the Ancient Seed page.

Blueberry Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Blueberries.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 40g.When harvested, each Blueberry plant gives 3 Blueberries every 4 days, with a small random chance for more Blueberries.

A Coffee Bean is both a crop and a plantable seed. Coffee Beans grow and mature 10 days after being planted (and every 2 days thereafter) in either Spring or Summer. Placing 5 Coffee Beans inside a Keg will produce Coffee.They have a rare chance to drop from Dust Sprites (about 1%). They can also be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 2,500g (25% chance) or 100-1,000g (1.26% chance).When harvested, each plant gives four beans every two days, with a small random chance for more beans.

Corn Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Corn.They can be purchased at Pierre's General Store for 150g, at JojaMart for 187g, and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 75g.

Grass can be harvested with the Scythe to produce Hay, once a Silo is built. Animals will not eat it, and it will not grow, but it can be harvested to create Hay.

Hops Starter is a type of seed. Mature plants yield Hops.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 30g.

Melon Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Melons.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. Nine seeds can be obtained from Gunther at the Museum after donating 10 unique Minerals. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 40g.

Pepper Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Hot Peppers.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 20g.When harvested, each Hot Pepper plant gives 1 Hot Pepper every 3 days, with a small random chance for more Hot Peppers.

Poppy Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Poppy flowers.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 50g.

Radish Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Radishes.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 20g.

Red Cabbage Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Red Cabbage.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store starting in Year 2 and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 50g.

Spangle Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Summer Spangle flowers.They can be purchased  at Pierre's General Store, at JojaMart and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 25g.

Starfruit Seeds are a type of seed. Mature plants yield Starfruit.They can be purchased at the Oasis and occasionally from the Travelling Cart. One seed can be obtained from Gunther at the Museum after donating 15 unique Minerals. They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 200g.

Summer Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Su), but when crafted, the result is Summer Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Spice Berry, Grape, or Sweet Pea.  Summer Seeds are the only wild seeds that can produce a non-forage crop, the Grape. Summer Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Spring Seeds, Fall Seeds, and Winter Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage.  While Farming Skill normally increases the chance to grow a quality crop, Foraging Skill increases the chance to grow a quality crop from Summer Seeds.    A mature plant grown from a Summer Seed may leave untilled soil in its place, when harvested.  Any fertilizer used will be lost in this case.Crows do not attack crops grown from Summer Seeds, so the use of Scarecrows is unnecessary.Sources

They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker. When shipped, they sell for 25g.When harvested, each Tomato plant gives 1 Tomato every 4 days, with a small random chance for more Tomatoes.

They can also be obtained by using the Seed Maker, as well as having a chance of being planted when using Mixed Seeds. When shipped, they sell for 5g.

Winter Seeds are a type of Crafted seed in Stardew Valley. The crafting recipe is labeled Wild Seeds (Wi), but when crafted, the result is Winter Seeds.  Mature plants yield, at random, a Crocus, Crystal Fruit, Snow Yam, or Winter Root.  Winter Seeds are the only seed that can grow outdoors during Winter.Winter Seeds are one of the season-specific crafted wild seeds, along with Spring Seeds, Summer Seeds, and Fall Seeds that produce crops normally found as forage. The Green Bean is a crop that grows from Bean Starter after 10 days.This crop uses a trellis, and continues to produce after maturity. Be aware, you cannot move onto a tile with a trellis, but you must be adjacent to a planted tile in order to harvest the plant. You must plan the layout of your plantings in order to guarantee access for harvesting.
Kale is a crop that grows from Kale Seeds after 6 days.
The Parsnip is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Parsnip Seeds after 4 days.
The Potato is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Potato Seeds after 6 days.
Rhubarb is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Rhubarb Seeds after 13 days. They are purchased from the Oasis.

The Tulip is a flower crop that grows from Tulip Bulbs after 6 days.  Tulips can be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 100-1,000g.

Starfruit is a crop in Stardew Valley. It grows from Starfruit Seeds after 13 days.  It produces Artisan Goods that have some of the highest sell values in the game.
Summer Spangle is a flower crop that grows from Spangle Seeds after 8 days.
The Tomato is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Tomato Seeds after 11 days.

Wheat is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Wheat Seeds after 4 days.In addition to Beer, players have the ability to craft Wheat Flour from Wheat by using a Mill. Once placed in the mill, one wheat will make one wheat flour. Wheat flour will appear in the box on the right side of the mill the following morning.

A Large Log is a type of tree in Stardew Valley. They can be found on the Farm and in Cindersap Forest (blocking the entrance to the Secret Woods). Large Logs drops 8 Hardwood when harvested with a Steel Axe or better. Once harvested, they will not respawn.

A Large Stump is a type of tree in Stardew Valley. They can be found on the Farm and in the Secret Woods. Large Stump drop 2 Hardwood when harvested with a Copper Axe or better.Large Stump will not respawn on the Farm, but they do respawn in the Secret Woods.Six (6) Large Stumps respawn daily in the Secret Woods, making it possible to obtain 12 Hardwood per day.

If a tree or other items are directly adjacent, the tree will not grow. Once fully grown, items can be placed near the tree. When tapped, it yields a Maple Syrup.Maple trees have a chance to drop a Hazelnut when shaken or chopped down during Fall.

Obtaining the first Mushroom Tree is a random event that can only happen in the Fall. On each day of Fall there is a 5% chance of a spawning event being triggered. When triggered, the game engine will choose 10 farm tiles at random. If any of those ten tiles have a fully grown, untapped forest tree (or tree stump), then that tree will transform into a Mushroom Tree (or Mushroom Stump).  A Mushroom Stump can grow into a Mushroom Tree, but not until the next Spring.A Mushroom Tree can be tapped with a tapper. It yields Red Mushroom, Purple Mushroom, and Common Mushroom when tapped, except during the Winter.
If a tree or other items are directly adjacent, the tree will not grow. Once fully grown, items can be placed near the tree. When tapped, it yields Oak Resin.
If a tree or other items are directly adjacent, the tree will not grow. Once fully grown, items can be placed near the tree. When tapped, it yields Pine Tar.

For each full year since maturing, fruit trees will produce higher quality fruit, up to iridium star quality after three years.  Note that fruit quality will not increase if the surrounding tiles are not kept clear.  Several players have reported that crafted floors and paths as well as grass do not hinder the progression of quality fruit.If struck by lightning during a storm, the tree will produce Coal for a number of days instead of fruit.Fruit trees can be planted in the Greenhouse.

The Apple Sapling is a Fruit Tree sapling that takes 28 days to grow into an Apple Tree, after which it will produce one fruit each day during the Fall.It can be purchased from Pierre's General Store and occasionally from the Travelling Cart.

The Apricot Sapling is a Fruit Tree sapling that takes 28 days to grow into an Apricot Tree, after which it will produce one fruit each day during the Spring.It can be purchased from Pierre's General Store and occasionally from the Travelling Cart.

Amaranth is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Amaranth Seeds after 7 days.
Artichokes are a crop that grows from Artichoke Seeds after 8 days.

The Beet is a vegetable crop that grows from Beet Seeds after 6 days.  Beet Seeds can be purchased from the Oasis.Players have the ability to craft Sugar from Beets by using a Mill. Once placed in the mill, one Beet will make three sugar. Sugar will appear in the box on the right side of the mill the following morning.
Bok Choy is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Bok Choy Seeds after 4 days.
Cauliflower is a crop that grows from Cauliflower Seeds after 12 days. Cauliflower is one of only three crops that can grow into a giant crop.
Corn is a crop that grows from Corn Seeds after 14 days.
Eggplant is a crop that grows from Eggplant Seeds after 5 days.
The Fiddlehead Fern is a foraged vegetable found in the Secret Woods during Summer.
Garlic is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Garlic Seeds after 4 days.

The Green Bean is a crop that grows from Bean Starter after 10 days.This crop uses a trellis, and continues to produce after maturity. Be aware, you cannot move onto a tile with a trellis, but you must be adjacent to a planted tile in order to harvest the plant. You must plan the layout of your plantings in order to guarantee access for harvesting.

Hops is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Hops Starter after 11 days.Hops can be put into a Keg to make Pale Ale. Pale Ale has one of the highest returns on investment in the game, surpassed only by Starfruit wine.
Kale is a crop that grows from Kale Seeds after 6 days.
The Parsnip is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Parsnip Seeds after 4 days.
The Potato is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Potato Seeds after 6 days.

The Pumpkin is a crop that grows from Pumpkin Seeds after 13 days.  It is one of three crops which might produce a giant crop, along with Cauliflower and Melon. After Starfruit it has the second-highest per unit base price of all the normal crops.
The Radish is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Radish Seeds after 6 days.
Red Cabbage is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Red Cabbage Seeds after 9 days.
The Tomato is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Tomato Seeds after 11 days.

Wheat is a crop in Stardew Valley. They grow from Wheat Seeds after 4 days.In addition to Beer, players have the ability to craft Wheat Flour from Wheat by using a Mill. Once placed in the mill, one wheat will make one wheat flour. Wheat flour will appear in the box on the right side of the mill the following morning.
The Yam is a crop in Stardew Valley that grows from Yam Seeds after 10 days. It also has a 3% chance of dropping from Duggies.
The Clam is a fish that can be found in the ocean during any season using a Crab Pot. It can also be foraged from The Beach.
It seems to be easier to catch in front of Willy's house using low power throws.
It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file.
The Clam is a fish that can be found in the ocean during any season using a Crab Pot. It can also be foraged from The Beach.

It is also known as one of the five Legendary Fish. You can only catch it once per save file.A strategy to catch this fish is to stay in the middle of the fishing minigame area until the fish begins resting somewhere else (such as the bottom or top), then stay there. The fish will move up and down continuously to shake you off and staying in the middle will allow for a slow but continuous catch.

The fish can be caught there in any season during any weather at any time. Once the passage has been opened the player can return there whenever they wish.It's challenging to fish for Slimejack, as the bugs inside the Mutant Bug Lair will continuously spawn and attack the player while fishing.

The Barbed Hook is a Tackle, that helps fishing by keeping the fishing bar attached to the catch. It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 1,000g, or crafted.  It can also be won from the Festival of Ice.

The Cork Bobber is a Tackle, that helps fishing by increasing the fishing bar by 24 pixels, which is a 25% to 13.6% increase depending on your fishing skill level (without buffs). It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 750g, or crafted.

The Dressed Spinner is a Tackle, that helps fishing by reducing maximum delay before a nibble by 7.5 seconds. It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 1,000g, crafted, or as the reward for completing the  Lake Fish Bundle. It can also be won from the Festival of Ice or found in Fishing Treasure Chests.  It can also be received as a gift from Willy at the Feast of the Winter Star.

The Lead Bobber is a Tackle, that helps fishing by preventing the bar from bouncing. It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 200g after achieving Fishing Level 6.  It can also be purchased from the Travelling Cart for 450-1,000g.
The Spinner is a Tackle, that helps fishing by reducing maximum delay before a nibble by 3.75 seconds. At Fishing Level 6, it can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 500g or crafted.
The Trap Bobber is a Tackle, that helps fishing by causing the catching bar to decrease 66% slower.  It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 500g, or crafted.

The Treasure Hunter is a Tackle, that helps fishing by preventing fish escape while collecting Treasure Chests, and by increasing the chance to find Treasure Chests by 33% (20% instead of the base 15%).  It can be purchased from Willy's Fish Shop for 750g, or crafted.
??Foroguemon?? is a secret piece of furniture obtained by placing a Strange Bun in the toy chest in Vincent's room of 1 Willow Lane.

??HMTGF?? is a secret piece of furniture obtained by placing a Super Cucumber in the brown box located north of the Blacksmith's shop, inside the fenced area. A hole in the fence allowing access to the box is hidden behind a tree on the right-hand side of the enclosure.
??Pinky Lemon?? is a secret piece of furniture obtained by placing Duck Mayonnaise in the partially hidden purple box in the back room of The Stardrop Saloon.
The Bear Statue is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 50 items to the Museum.

The Catalogue is a piece of Furniture that can be purchased from Pierre's General Store for 30,000g.Once placed, right-clicking the catalogue allows the player to purchase every wallpaper and flooring item for 0g in unlimited quantity.The catalogue is similar to the Furniture Catalogue sold at the Carpenter's Shop, which gives access to Furniture items.

The Ceramic Pillar is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 250g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g.It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.
The Chicken Statue is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating the Chicken Statue Artifact to the Museum.

The China Cabinet is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 6,000g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g.It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.

The Decorative Bowl is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 250g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.Players who select the Standard farm map during character creation will have one inside their house when the game begins.

The Decorative Lantern is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 500g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.Players who select a Wilderness farm map during character creation will have one inside their house when the game begins.

The Drum Block is a crafted piece of Furniture. The recipe can be obtained from Robin's 6 heart event. The Drum Block itself can be obtained as a reward for donating the Ancient Drum artifact to the Museum. If you right-click on a drum block, you can change the sound it emits when you walk past.

The Flute Block is a crafted piece of Furniture. The recipe can be obtained from Robin's 6 heart event. The Flute Block itself can be obtained as a reward for donating the Bone Flute artifact to the Museum. If you right-click on a flute block, you can change the sound it emits when you walk past.

The Furniture Catalogue can be purchased at the Carpenter's Shop for 200,000g, after upgrading the farmhouse.Once placed, right-clicking on the furniture catalogue allows the player to purchase furniture items for 0g in unlimited quantity. With the exception of the items listed in the table below, every furniture item is available.The furniture catalogue is similar to the Catalogue sold at Pierre's General Store, which gives access to wallpaper and flooring.The furniture catalogue can also be used as a display table. Selecting an inventory item and right-clicking on the catalogue will place the item on the middle of the catalogue.

The Futan Bear is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 1,500g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.

The Globe is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 750g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.

The Industrial Pipe is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 300g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.
The Junimo Plush is a secret piece of furniture.  It can be found by right-clicking a bush in the northwest corner of Pelican Town on the 28th of any season at exactly 12:00pm.
Leah's Sculpture is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only from Leah's 6 hearts event.
The Lg. Futan Bear is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 30 items to the Museum.

The Model Ship is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 750g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g.It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.Players who select a Riverland farm map during character creation will have one inside their house when the game begins.
The Obsidian Vase is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 31 Minerals to the Museum.
The Plush Bunny is a piece of furniture that can be purchased for 2,000g from Pierre's booth at the Egg Festival.

The Singing Stone is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 21 Minerals to the Museum.  It plays musical notes when right-clicked.It is one of a few furniture items that must be struck with a tool to pick up and move.
The Skeleton Statue is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 15 Artifacts to the Museum.
The Sloth Skeleton is a furniture item composed of three pieces.  Each piece can be obtained by donating skeleton Artifacts to the Museum.

The Small Crystal is a piece of furniture. It can rotate into daily stock at the Carpenter's Shop for 750g or the Travelling Cart for between 250-2,500g. It's also available from the Furniture Catalogue for 0g.Players who select a Hill-top farm map during character creation will have one inside their house when the game begins.
The Standing Geode is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by donating 11 Minerals to the Museum.
The Stardew Hero Trophy is a piece of furniture that can be obtained only by completing all Bundles in the Community Center.

The Statue of Endless Fortune is a piece of Furniture that can be purchased for 1,000,000g from an NPC in the Casino. It produces one gift or item each day. It's possible to own multiple statues.The statue is one of the most expensive items in the game and is the second fastest way of obtaining Iridium Bars. The fastest way is through the Statue of Perfection, which gives 2-8 Iridium Ore daily.
The Statue of Perfection is a piece of Furniture obtained by interacting with Grandpa's Shrine once all four candles are lit (see Grandpa's Evaluation). It produces 2-8 Iridium Ore each day.
The Tea Set is a piece of furniture obtained as a gift from a Secret Gift-Giver at the Feast of the Winter Star.Any adult other than Clint, Evelyn, Marnie, Robin, or Willy may give you a Tea Set.
